You're on a forum based on a game that shoots cartoony little green men into space. Think about that for a minute.

A friend has a Macbook, so I put the 0.13 demo on his machine a while ago for his (I think 8 and 11 year old at the time) kids to play with. The next week he was phoning me to say "half the kids at their school are playing that thing now." Think on that too.

Give Mario Kart DS and 7 a try, before dismissing them as being "for kids". There's more gameplay in those than quite a lot of "serious" car games.

Besides, while Nintendo might be a family-friendly company, there are still some pretty gruesome third party titles. This isn't the bad old days of the SNES where Ninty were insisting that the red pixels in Mortal Kombat be changed to white to look like sweat instead of blood.
May I point out (and flagrantly promote), for anyone who doesn't already know, that MS have done a complete 180 on the DRM.
